channel.title: Webclient issue. >>class client.class not found<<
channel.description:
I don't know what's wrong with this webclient. I've went over my codes 10-20 times and have not come across a single error..
My cache is uploaded to dropbox with the correct link in the correct spot: [code] downloadcache("http://dl.dropbox.com/u/2320554/cache.zip", "cache.zip", "", "cache"); [/code] The zipped file is named "cache.zip"
My signlink is done correctly: [code] public static final String findcachedir() { String s; String s1; File file; s = "C:/.xelphoria_file_store_32/"; s1 = ""; file = new File((new StringBuilder()).append(s1).append(s).toString()); if(file.exists() || file.mkdir()) { [/code]
And finally, all of the sprites loading from class30_sub2_sub1_Sub1 look like this:
[code] C:/.xelphoria_file_store_32/Files/Spirts/ [/code]
I've jarred and signed the client 100% right, a multitude of times.
Yet I get this error still: [code] load: class client.class not found. java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass0(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Exception: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class [/code]
Something that might help: I've gotten the webclient to load previously(no idea how..)but I had a "connection error" after the cache was downloaded. The files/folders in the cache.zip file (other than the cache, itself) couldn't be downloaded.
I have no idea what I'm doing wrong. Please help me. Spoonfeeding is much appreciated, as I've been working on this for nearly 2 weeks. If somebody could TV me, that would be a lot of help, as well.
Thanks in advance.

item.title: Webclient issue. >>class client.class not found<<
item.dc:creator: @legit_99 legit 99
item.description:
@legit_99 wrote:

I don’t know what’s wrong with this webclient. I’ve went over my codes 10-20 times and have not come across a single error…

My cache is uploaded to dropbox with the correct link in the correct spot:

downloadcache("http://dl.dropbox.com/u/2320554/cache.zip", "cache.zip", "", "cache");

The zipped file is named “cache.zip”

My signlink is done correctly:

public static final String findcachedir()
{
String s;
String s1;
File file;
s = "C:/.xelphoria_file_store_32/";
s1 = "";
file = new File((new StringBuilder()).append(s1).append(s).toString());
if(file.exists() || file.mkdir())
{

And finally, all of the sprites loading from class30_sub2_sub1_Sub1 look like this:

C:/.xelphoria_file_store_32/Files/Spirts/

I’ve jarred and signed the client 100% right, a multitude of times.

Yet I get this error still:

load: class client.class not found.
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass0(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Exception: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class

Something that might help:
I’ve gotten the webclient to load previously(no idea how…)but I had a “connection error” after the cache was downloaded. The files/folders in the cache.zip file (other than the cache, itself) couldn’t be downloaded.

I have no idea what I’m doing wrong. Please help me. Spoonfeeding is much appreciated, as I’ve been working on this for nearly 2 weeks. If somebody could TV me, that would be a lot of help, as well.

Thanks in advance.
